opportunities.name: In Just 15 Minutes, You Can Help Make a Difference in a Young Person's Life
opportunities.description: Thousands of young Tulsans cannot get the help they need to succeed because they lack adequate transportation to get to clinics, educational opportunities, training, or social service agencies.

opportunities.name: Beginning Computer Instructor
opportunities.description: Seeking volunteer to instruct our beginning computer class.

opportunities.name: Food Pantry
opportunities.description: Food pantry volunteer to assist families that make appointments to receive food in our food pantry.

opportunities.name: Drive To Save Lives!
opportunities.description: We need a driver to help our women get to their appointments. We have a ministry vehicle for volunteers to use.

opportunities.name: Math Mentors
opportunities.description: Math is the language of science, and without the basics, many students give up before Algebra, closing the door to a future in STEM.

opportunities.name: Star Wars Drone Competition
opportunities.description: The Flight Night Drone Competition has three division levels that test the young pilot’s skills through a series of flying tasks.

opportunities.name: Pathways Mentorship Program
opportunities.description: Together these pairs work one hour per week on individualized curriculum in math, reading, and life skills. Pairs also form beautiful friendships.

opportunities.name: Pathways Guest Speaker
opportunities.description: Pathways is looking for guest speakers to share their professional, personal, and spiritual expertise in the classroom.

opportunities.name: Murals
opportunities.description: We have some blank walls that are begging for murals/decoration.

opportunities.name: Help Students and Their Parents with Financial Aid Applications
opportunities.description: Our Volunteers will initially be targeting the Oklahoma’s Promise program for 8th through 10th graders that pays full tuition to Oklahoma colleges

opportunities.name: JA Classroom Programs
opportunities.description: JA Volunteers make school relevant and fun, which means students are more likely to become contributing, successful members of their communities.

opportunities.name: Help Homeless and Injured Animals
opportunities.description: Interested in volunteering to help our community's homeless and injured animals?

opportunities.name: Data Entry
opportunities.description: Perfect opportunity for someone that is retired, or has extra time on their hands year-round.

opportunities.name: JUVENGAF
opportunities.description: The volunteer most to have a great attitude and be responsible preferences between the ages 18 to 25 years old women or man and availability to works Saturdays and sometimes the afternoons in the week.

opportunities.name: Videographer / Photographer for Room Reveals
opportunities.description: We are searching for a videographer with equipment to film room reveals.

opportunities.name: Community Educator
opportunities.description: These volunteers deliver Alzheimer’s Association Core Curriculum using prepared training materials on topics related to Alzheimer’s disease and other dementias as well as information for individuals and families impacted by the disease.

opportunities.name: Done-In-A-Day
opportunities.description: Done-in-a-day volunteers play a vital role in creating a first impression for our office by greeting guests.

opportunities.name: Caregiver Support Group Facilitator
opportunities.description: The goal of Alzheimer's Association support groups is to provide emotional, social and/or educational support to group members.

opportunities.name: Community Representative
opportunities.description: AACRs serve as liaisons between the Alzheimer's Association and local groups such as neighborhoods, rural counties, business and civic organizations or faith communities.

opportunities.name: Donation Processors
opportunities.description: Primary responsibility is to process donations for EIS’ free clothing and baby boutique.

opportunities.name: East Side Family Interviewer
opportunities.description: Family Interviewers have the opportunity to work directly with the families in crisis to determine their needs and to provide them with available items.

opportunities.name: National Mentoring Month
opportunities.description: Reading Partners needs an additional 500 volunteers to serve students who are still waiting for tutors this year.

opportunities.name: Reach & Rise Mentoring Program
opportunities.description: Children need someone to trust, someone to show them they have value, someone who cares.  Being a mentor to a child guarantees that at least one person cares about that child's well-being and wants to see that child succeed!

opportunities.name: Virtual Volunteer Reading Tutors Needed in Tulsa
opportunities.description: Rise up for reading. Reading Partners believes that our communities do better when all students have access to high-quality learning opportunities.

opportunities.name: Hospice Volunteer: Patient Companionship
opportunities.description: Patient Companionship is ALL about spending time with individuals who need community.

opportunities.name: Big Brothers Big Sisters
opportunities.description: We need men, women and couples to volunteer as mentors for at-risk children ages 6 to 18.

opportunities.name: Seamstresses Needed
opportunities.description: Through this program volunteers who are experienced sewers turn the clothing from our patients into keepsake memory bears.

opportunities.name: Haircuts at Home
opportunities.description: Looking for licensed cosmetologists to provide 3-4 free haircuts a month for our terminally ill patients.

opportunities.name: Hospice Volunteer
opportunities.description: Suncrest Hospice is looking for volunteers to join the Suncrest Team as we provide excellent care and support to our hospice patients and their families in their homes!

opportunities.name: Hospice Volunteer
opportunities.description: Suncrest Hospice is looking for volunteers to join the Suncrest Team as we provide excellent care and support to our hospice patients and their families in their homes!

opportunities.name: Community Based Big
opportunities.description: Enjoy activities around the community with your Little, 2-4 times a month for a few hours.

opportunities.name: School-Based Big
opportunities.description: Meet the child at their school to do a variety of on-campus activities. Does require an application, interview, and background check. Will meet with Little at their school, during school hours.

opportunities.name: Big Couple Match
opportunities.description: You and your partner will mentor a child together as a community-based match.

opportunities.name: Bike MS: Oklahoma 2023
opportunities.description: The MS Society is hosting a Two-Day Bike Ride that starts in Tulsa, Oklahoma, and finishes in Bartlesville, Oklahoma.
